Package ch.mazluc.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
ch.mazluc.game.Game
public class Game extends Object

Manages the game cycle.

Every game has a list of players, a grid on which cards are layed upon and a console interaction utility that manages user input.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Luca Mazza

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Constructor. Initializes the console interaction util.

  • Method Details

    • printStartScreen

      public void printStartScreen()
      Print the start screen. Prints the title of the game. Reads the user input to continue.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game. Reads the game settings from the user. Initializes the players and the grid. Fills the grid with cards.

    • takeGuess

      public Card takeGuess(int player)
      Take a guess. Asks the user for a coordinate, which is checked if it is in the bounds and if it is not null.
      Parameters:
      player - the index of the player
      Returns:
      the card

    • start

      public void start() throws InterruptedException
      Start the game.

      Game cycle:

      • take 2 guesses
      • if the guesses are the same, the player gets 2 points and plays again
      • if the guesses are different, the player gets 0 points and the next player plays
      When the grid is empty the game is over
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - when the game is interrupted

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroy the game. Closes the scanner.
